The dim sum like appetizers are really good. And if you order one main plate with rice and dim sum.... its yum!
author: Leila H.

description: It's almost a cliche.  The server who doesn't write down your order, even if you're with a party of four, like in my case last night.  Every time this happens I think to myself... "I don't care if she doesn't write down the order as long as she gets it right."  But last night she messed it up.  She offered to fix her mistake but we were with our two and four year old kids, so waiting an extra 10 minutes was not an option.  I was pissed that they didn't adjust the bill and let them know when I paid.  Oh yeah, she forgot about us after serving our meal, so I had to walk to the back and ask if someone could ring up my check.  That's when I told them my complaint and their response was...no I'm not kidding...wait for it...."Sorry, some times they get too busy in the kitchen to pay attention to the details of the order."  Yup, word for word.  This might all be forgettable if the food was better.  It's average.  Period.  You can throw a rock and hit 3 other places just as good but with better service.
author: Mister H.

description:
Mediocre - overpriced, decent service

Standard Chinese food with a hefty price tag, relative to other good places. Chalk it up to location and sit-in dining, but that's just smoke and mirrors.

Walnut Prawns dish (standard Chinese fare) is breaded as though it was Sweet and Sour (is it just a big dough ball?). Inedible.

Even Dragon Well (pricey, marina-ized Chestnut St. outfit) does it better, and at similar price point.  Come to think of it, this place rivals Dragon Well in price, but NOT in food.
Beef, chicken, and pork dishes use meat that is strangely soft and seemingly undercooked.

A couple things are ok, if you're REALLY in a pinch, but seriously, if you're ordering in, so many places on Lombard are better (ie. Feng Shui).
author: Bamboo T.

description: Amazing peking duck! Have ordered it like 8 times since I've been here (3 month period).
author: Joseph G.

description: got take-out and nothing was good.  the mu shu pork was the best thing we ordered.  won ton soup was ok.  the dim sum was not edible.  the dumplings were terrible.  giving two stars because the delivery was fast.
author: Auren H.

description: For those who know Tai Chi, Country Sky is what Tai Chi used to be. Giving that it is run by their old chef and manager. Food is really great for what it is and prices are good too. Every dish we had was great and can't wait to go back again.
author: M C.

description:
Always on a quest for the perfect Chinese Delivery, I turned to Yelp and came across Country Sky. Our order guy was pretty friendly and also gave me the heads up that they were busy that night and would be about an hour (was 45 minutes in actuality, I like that, am easy to impress I suppose).

Delivery guy was also nice and courteous, so far so good. Foodwise, I should give this place 3 stars but am going with 4 overall for the service. Our General Tso's Chicken was a disappointment - more limp than crispy, but our steamed pot stickers were pretty tasty. The shrimp fried rice was also prepared well, although we could have been happier with more than four shrimp. The real standout was the moo shoo pork, which was perhaps the best I've had in sometime; sadly the hoisin sauce was a little watery.

Will we order from here again? Perhaps not as sure as the sky is blue, but I'm guessing another shot is deserving.
author: Nish N.

description:
Sesame meatless chicken is soooooooooooooooo good.  Its fried but the batter is very thin.  Its a sweet and sour sauce but its not over the top sweet.  Anyways, its the best tasting meatless dish ever!!  (Eat it all hot, not good as left over. Its not real fried chicken after all.) 

Five stars because its clean inside and they have this awesome sesame meatless chicken dish.
author: Wakako U.

description:
We are definitely fans of Country Sky.  We ordered take out and the food was super hot even after our drive home. Our order included the following: 

1. Honey Gazed Walnut Prawns-delicious probably because they are deep fried! So happy to find a place that doesn't pair these shrimp with a mayo based sauce. 

2. Veggie fried rice

3. Chicken with Black Bean Sauce

4.  Mu Shu pork (their pancakes are amazing; we think homemade!)

5. Veggie Chow Fun 

Everything was delicious, not greasy and seasoned well. We haven't enjoyed Chinese food this much in a long time.
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description:
Three words for you, my friends: DELIVERY.  DIM.  SUM.

I simultaneously praise the god that gave me such a thing and curse him for introducing me to it only right before we're about to move out of this hood and no doubt out of Country Sky's delivery area.

The first time we ordered Country Sky's delivery dim sum, I expected it to be semi-crappy, because, really...delivery dim sum?!   My mind just couldn't wrap itself around the concept.  Imagine how pleasantly surprised/addicted I was to discover that their dim sum was in fact, quite good.  My favorite pieces are probably the Siu Mai, the Shanghai pork bun, the shrimp dumplings (which use amazingly good and fresh tasting shrimp - something you don't always get at good dim sum restaurants), and the chicken bun, which reminds me of a dim sum version of Jimmy Dean's sausage biscuit.  I realize this may not be a winning description for some of you, but a) Jimmy Dean's sausage biscuits are delicious, and b) I am a classy lady with sophisticated tastes.

Their menu has a large selection of vegetarian choices, even in the dim sum section (although be aware - the fried chive dumpling contains shrimp).  Delivery can take a little long (~30-45 minutes), but this is due to the dim sum being steamed immediately before delivery, and the piping hot pieces make the wait very worthwhile.
author: Tanya N.

description: We were visiting from San Antonio and happened upon this place while walking around the neighborhood.  It was so good!  The sesame beef and chicken were awesome.  The hot and sour soup and pork fried rice were terrific too.  We ended up going twice before heading back to Texas.  Enjoy!
author: Monica C.

description:
I was very pleasantly surprised by Country Sky.  Not everything that we ordered was "authentic" (I have very high standards when it comes to authenticity of chinese food) but in terms of taste, I thought the food was great.  

What I love about this place is the dim sum menu, which has about 15 standard items.  The pan-fried turnip cake was maybe one of the best I've ever had -- it had the crispy outer layer that so many sub-par turnip cakes are missing.  We also had the chive and shrimp dumplings, which were tasty but had a bit too much cilantro. 

My boyfriend ordered the General Cho's meatless chicken, which I had mixed feelings about.  First, General Cho's chicken is the equivalent of Panda Express chinese food or chop suey.  It's not real chinese food.  Second, meatless chicken?  Even after reading all the reviews on yelp about the sesame meatless chicken, I had some reservations.  However, one bite in and I was sold.  It's almost like eating meat -- the texture of the meatless nuggets (a mixture of soy and egg white, battered and deep-fried, per the owner) was almost like chicken (or rather, chicken nuggets)...and the sauce was pretty tasty, however inauthentic the dish actually is.    

The one little thing I was disappointed by is what they call the "steamed won ton" -- when I asked the owner what this was, he said it was "hong yo chao tso" (aka wontons in hot chili oil, a standard taiwanese dish).  What appeared before me was not what I was expecting -- it really was just won tons with a hot sauce/soy sauce mixture.  Sigh.   Also, they did not have white pepper for the hot and sour soup, a requirement for any chinese restaurant.  My hot and sour soup is just not complete without that little kick of spice.

Other high points -- good service; clean, well-decorated space; reasonable prices; and a take-out menu!
author: Mitzi C.

description:
1) They do dim sum for delivery and the dim sum is better than anything you'd get in Chinatown.  It might not beat that random spot down at 42nd and Balboa or the corporate dim sum you get at Yank Sing, but it's great for delivery.
2) People who rate a place based on the quality of their Chow Mein need to think again. The fried rice and chow mein here isn't anything to write home about, but they do mostly delivery and so that's par for the course.  It's not bad, just not mind-blowing.
3) The orange chicken is 1000% better than anywhere in the city.  It isn't like Panda Express, though it is still lightly fried.  It just has full flavor and taste.

The delivery is usually 45 minutes, but they do it well, package it up well, and seem to be consistently good.  I've gottan taken out about a half-dozen times over the last six months from this place and it hits the spot.
author: David U.

description:
It's the tastiest chinese joint in the marina.  If you live up here like I do, diversity is tough on this side of town.

Hot & Sour Soup.  Oh yeah.  That hits the spot.  This place nails it for me, 100%.  It's the perfect balance of hot and sour.  Some places pour in 3 cups of vinegar for every cup of water, and then some.  I love CSky's soup because it's perfect (for me). I'm uber picky about my Hot N Sours, and any place that can whip it up like this has my vote!  The Szechuan Beef was crispy and delicious, as was the pork dish I ordered but I can't exactly remember which one....

Their restaurant is small and casual, but their food is better than one would think.  We've also ordered from CSky for my office when working late and everything we had was delicious as well.  

I think this is as good as it gets, especially for the Marina.  Not better than some of my faves in Chinatown, but damn close.
author: Joanne D.

description: Great service. I never knew this place existed until I walked by. They have a lot of veggie options, which is pretty rare for Chinese restaurants. I ordered won ton noodle soup, which was pretty good. My hubby got kung pao meatless chicken, which was yummy. A lot of people order delivery from here, and I will too in the future.
author: Natalie S.

description: We order from this place all the time and it is always great. We usually go for chicken or vegetarian dishes. I always get the green onion pancake. It is the best I have ever had! We order delivery and they are always super fast with nice customer service.
author: J F.

description: Pretty darn good food with a great Dim Sum menu. Quick delivery and they take credit cards. What more could you want when you don't feel like cooking? Beef and Broccoli is good and they even manage not to over cook the broccoli. Tasty little BBQ Pork Buns that you don't see too often.
author: Drea L.

description: Food is great and affordable. You'll probably have to flag someone down for a refill but definitely recommend it!
author: Beryl W.

description:
As part of an ongoing project to try new places, my girlfriend and I decided to walk into Country Sky.  We had seen some other yelp reviews, and figured meatless sesame chicken screams out for some experimental tasting.  Well, we skipped the meatless sesame chicken and went all in on the meatless General Cho's chicken.  I hate myself already for the next sentence I am going to write, but you have got to try this stuff.  The owner explained that it was a combo of tofu and egg whites.  I don't know how they made it so tasty, but they're probably guarding the secret more closely than the formula to Coke.  

The other bonus to this place is that it has dim sum at night.  We had the best turnip cake I have ever had.  It was like a massive but tastier hash brown without the guilt.  The shrimp and chive dumplings were a little too steamed and watery, but that was my only complaint.  

The actual space was a little small, and it took awhile to bring us our meatless chicken.  (It's not like they had to kill and pluck the chicken.)  Otherwise, I recommend this place.
author: Chris I.

description:
I was literally sitting at home, minding my own damn business, doing a little Yelping, when I saw Liz L's review of Country Sky pop up on my screen.  The words "general tso's meatless chicken" almost made my heart stop.  Ever since leaving Atlanta, home of my beloved Harmony Vegetarian, I have been on the hunt for another restaurant that makes a dish as fabulous as the general's chicken at Harmony.

So, my fiance and I ran to Country Sky post haste.  OMG.  I think we have a new favorite Chinese restaurant.  It was so good!  The general's chicken was very different than the version at Harmony, but it was delightful.  We also had the string beans in black bean sauce, also yummy.  We totally scarfed it all down.  The man working there came to gather up our plates and seemed shocked by our clean plate club status. :)  Delish!

Although the restaurant itself is small, the decor is really nice.  Everything about our meal here was wonderful.  We'll definitely be back.
author: Squirrel L.

description:
I live in the Tenderloin, so I am cursed with a small selection of places that are willing to come out here to deliver.

There also isn't very much dim sum around here.  Most of that is in the Sunset/Richmond.

Enter Country Sky Chinese Cuisine: a Chinese restaurant in the Marina that not only delivers to the Tenderloin, but ALSO has dim sum on the menu!

I'm used to people being pretty grumpy/impatient with me on the phone.  However, the man who took my call was VERY patient with me, even after I told him that I didn't have a menu and would be trying to order some of my favorite dim sum items based on memory alone.

My order:

1) Steamed pork bun (3 pieces)
2) Chicken bun (3 pieces)
3) Siu mai (3 pieces)
4) Sesame seed balls (3 pieces)
5) Turnip cake (2 big pieces)
6) Shrimp dumplings (3 pieces)

Total: $22.

He explained that my order would take about 30-45 minutes to deliver, since they had to steam it first.  No problem.

Oh and also, all items mentioned above taste FANTASTIC.  My only disappointment was due to the fact that they didn't include a menu in the bag.  But if ordering sans menu didn't stop me before, it certainly wouldn't stop me from doing so again!

($15 min. for delivery; and no I'm not eating all these things tonight in one sitting.  I am definitely saving leftovers, since these pieces are a good size.)
author: Dwigt S.

description:
This place is awesome.  Not only is the food fresh and fantastic, but the people are truly delightful.  It is my go to place for good Chinese food and in my opinion one of the better places in the city.  

The veggie pot stickers and veggie fried rice are amazing as is everything else I've tried on the menu.  As for the people, I must say they are great too.  Last night, unbeknown to me I dropped my wallet and credit cards while picking up an order.  Boy was I surprised when the Country Sky delivery driver showed up to my door to bring them to me.  That is customer service and a perfect illustration of how the people are just as great as the food.

Thanks Country Sky!
author: j b.

description: Overcooked Kung Pao Chicken - more like Kung Pao Jerky. Added some veggies to it and was charged an extra $6. Never again.
author: Sean E.

description:
Absolutely delicious. 

Not sketchy, but still cheap. Knocked Oriental Pearl out of At&T Park. Country Sky is my new favorite .

- the food was fresh, not very heavy or greasy. Big PLUS. No MSG!!
- the dim sum combo- 9 large piece only $8, yummy in my tummy!
   (try the shrimp dumpling, soooo good)
- they give REAL Mu Shu pancakes (not dry, rubbery, or paper thin)
- when ordering won ton soup you can chose between chicken, shrimp or pork (chicken was delicious, lot's of fresh veggies too)
- also try the Honey Walnut Prawns - crispy light battered,(not soggy, like so many other restaurants)  sweet, and large prawns

A++  

and the restaurant was intimate, relaxing, and the servers was very nice!
author: Cary Elizabeth L.

description: Pretty cool place to have a meal! The food here is pretty good And you get a lot of it. Lots of items to choose from and it's all well priced. Service is pretty good and Everyones friendly. Only compliant is it's kind of small and when it gets crowded it can get very cramped in there. Definitely a place to check out.
author: Brandon D.

description: Seafood Delight - Also good!!! I have yet to find a dish that I don't like!!
author: Christina L.

description: This place was amazing!  Excellent food.  excellent service.  We went for lunch and tried the dim sum and several dishes...all were great.  I'm not an expert, but the food was tasty and well priced.  also, we went with 2 kids and they really enjoyed it.  Cute neighborhood too.  Would go back for sure.
author: Tammy R.

description: I was looking for a good Chinese restaurant that was easy to get to from where we stayed recently. I found Country Sky on Restaurant.com and saw the good reviews. We enjoyed the Hot and Sour Soup  immensely.  The Prawn with Triple Mushroom and Beef with Snow Peas was very good as well.  The staff was very friendly and patient with our slow decision making. We will try to make it there again for future visits to the City.
author: Carolyn S.

description: This place has a very good variety and not too salty or overdone with sauces.  I recommend the take-out for when you want to take a break from the kitchen.  Not the best in town, but EZ, convenient and timely when you place an order.  Good overall and generally, can't go wrong!
author: Craig A.

description:
Oh, if only Country Sky was not in the Marina, it would be getting a 5-star review. I rarely ever get Chinese food that's not delivery. Mainly this is because most sit-down Chinese in the Mission is forgettable at best. But I was pleased to discover such a nice place with delicious food, but still with low prices.

The pot-stickers are great - very doughy and not overly greasy. We had two veggie dishes - the Ma Po Bean Curd and the Buddha's Delight. They were both awesome. The tofu was cooked really well in both cases, very fresh vegetables, and light but tasty sauces.

The staff were very friendly and attentive. My only complaint was that there weren't a lot of vegetarian dim sum options. But the entrees are so good that it barely matters.
author: Sharon T.

description: The food is so so for the high price. Dishes are overly salty. They charge extra for rice.
author: Kenneth Y.

description:
I've been here twice in a matter of weeks, always dining in. A small dining area but always very nice service and fresh food.

We've been sampling our way through the dumplings on the dim sum menu, and they're all pretty tasty. The chive dumpling wasn't something I thought I would like, but it is a little ball of goodness. 

Also, the dumplings and noodles here aren't extravagantly greasy and won't leave you feeling like you just swalled a balloon filled with ball bearings and send you back home to your sofa to sleep it off. 

I've tried quite a few Dim Sum places near Chinatown (I live in North Beach) and this place overall is clean and pleasant, and at no point have I been yelled at by 2,438-year-old Chinese women. I have no idea why, but there are places in Chinatown where it seems I could walk in with fifty-dollar-bills hanging out of my pockets, wad them up and throw the money at them and they would still start screeching at me for no good reason. Mind you, I still go back when I'm in the mood, because some of those ancient ladies make some mean noodles and dumplings...but for a nice, quiet and pleasant experience, this joint has always come through.
author: Drew H.

description:
The best thing about living in the city is that you can stay cozy in your home when it's pouring outside and order delivery!  I was in the mood for Chinese and thought I'd try Country Sky because it was in my neighborhood, inexpensive, and had decent reviews. I'm not sure if I ordered the wrong things or what because it was terrible!

I had the Black Bean Chicken which was sour and tasted rancid.  How hard is it to stir-fry veggies, chicken and an already-made sauce? Apparently PRETTY HARD! The vegetarian Mapu was flavorless and bland.  I had to add soy sauce to get a decent bite out of this entree. Needless to say I'll be picking something else the next time a rainstorm rolls through SF. (which won't be too long! ha!)

Sheesh!
author: Candice M.

description: precise, personal (even if a little perfunctory) and prompt service. a little peace right off chestnut. say hi to Amy.
author: Matt J.

description: The New Country Sky has excellent Chinese food. As good as its going to get in the Marina if you are not willing to haul yourself to Clement Street. Good food at an affordable price. Perfect for take-out/delivery on those lazy days. Shrimp Lo-Mein and Eggplant with Garlic Sauce are among my favorites.
author: Tammy L.

description:
The best chinese food delivery we've ever had  in San Francisco. 

The portions are generous, the price is very reasonable, and the quality is very good.

Mu Shu Pork: 5/5 stars
Lemon Chicken: 5/5 stars
Buddha's Delight: 4/5 stars

they can customize your orders too.. We had Scrambled Eggs with BBQ pork as a dinner entree and it was deliciousss.

Their deliveries are very prompt (can you beat 30 minutes?) and their delivery guys are always very friendly and cheerful.

Update: the mushu pork hadn't been as good lately.. I think I should downgrade it to 3.5 stars.
author: Sheren H.

description:
I'll start with a 3 star. This tiny little place justed open in a place that turns over every couple of years. Situated in Marina's "restuarant court" of Steiner between Lombard and Chestnut, it offers a nice menu and even soon Dim Sum!

Started with the lunch special of Garlic Chicken and veggies. Nice flavor but however, light on the garlic. Will update as I go back.

Been back many times for lunch and it's good, so 4 stars now.
author: Ed L.

description:
I ordered seasame chicken and brown rice for delivery last night.  I specified all white-meat chicken, so no promises if you don't do that, but it was awesome.  Very crispy, and arrived on a bed of lettuce, which I enjoyed.  You don't get a huge portion like at some delivery Chinese food places, so you might not want to order one entree and share it across two people unless you are not a big eater.

I also ordered some dim sum (bbq pork buns, chicken buns, shumai).  I got the 3-item dim sum combo, but didn't realize I would get 3 of each item - a pleasant surprise but I guess what I should have expected for $7.95.  Everything was tasty

This is my new go-to Chinese when I want more traditional fare (i.e. not Dragon Well).  I will definitely be ordering again.
author: Ashley K.

description: Horrible service. They keep talking and fighting in Chinese to one another and ignoring the customer. Have received dry, burnt fried rice more than once. Also cheap assess when it comes to giving hot sauce with your to go order. Every time I have to ask, and they still forget to put it in the bag. The only reason I still go to them is because they are the closest to where I work unfortunately.
author: Ferhen M.

description:
This place is wonderful.  I ordered delivery and the service was quick, polite, and most important delicious!!!  I tried the broccoli chicken and the wonton soup.  Both were piping hot and delicious.  The wonton soup wasn't just watery broth, it was slightly thicker with tons of flavor, veggies and dumplings.  I would have been just as happy with the soup!

The only reason I gave this place 4 stars is that I have only tried to 2 items on the menu.  I reserve judgement for in-restaurant eating and more tasting.
author: Sasha R.

description: After a long busy sightseeing day while on vacation in SF my family and i found Country Sky within walking distance of our hotel. Tired and very hungry, we stumbled into this very cute and very tiny little restaurant. We were promptly greeted and seated by our server. We were still in time for the lunch specials and each of us ordered some dim sum and a different lunch item. The food was served quickly and was fresh and tasty. The sesame chicken and sweet and sour pork were really tasty and all of the dim sum we tried were really good. Now if you know anything about San Diego, you would know we are severely lacking in good Chinese restaurants, I wish there was a place like this closer to home. Country Sky may not be the best Chinese that SF has to offer, but to me it was a delicious lovely little place with friendly service and very comfortable atmosphere.
author: jeanette d.

description: LOVED IT!!!! While vacationing in SF my family and i found this little place and absolutely loved it.. we ordered the house fried rice, chow mein, and orange chicken...the staff was nice and the prices were reasonable... too bad i live waaayy out of their delivery radius.
author: M S.

description:
The good:  small, casual, and laid back atmosphere.  Sauces in dishes was PERFECT! no room for improvement there.

The bad: meat quality!  I got chicken and broccoli, and my friend got some beef noodle dish.  They were both to die for, but we both picked around the gross meat (no joke it was rubbery in texture and ground up) and left hungry. 

If they ever decide to pony up and pay for some decent quality protein, I would eat there every day!  This place is probably perfect for vegetarians, but I just have to have chicken or pork in my chinese food.
author: Ali G.

description: This place is AWESOME! I am Chinese and weary of Chinese restaurants. The quality of Country Sky's food is excellent. The vegetables are always fresh and plentiful. Chinese food has a bad reputation for being greasy and unhealthy; however, the reality is that Chinese food has a huge potential for being healthy and Country Sky embraces this. The people that work there are also very helpful. Even the dim sum is good and I doubt they make it there...but who knows, they might. The only downer about the place is that the menu doesn't come with descriptions; therefore, they have to put up with all of my questions regarding the contents of their many dishes.
author: Emily G.

description: The service here is amazing, and the food is delicious. Dim Sum and their meatless options are so great! Amy, the store owner, is a delight. Ask for the Thai ice tea and her mango pudding special!
author: Kevin G.

description: On recommendation, I tried the Spicy Chicken with Basil.  It was tangy, a little sweet and absolutely delicious!  Thanks for the suggestion!  Great service as well!
author: Sharee V.

description: This is a thrid times for me to go to Country Sky ( 2 times order food to go and once stay over there). the food is great, especially hot and sour soup. I love it. The staffs are super nice. I'm willing to go back there again.
author: thao h.

description: Awesome food and very friendly staff! Their hot and sour soup was delicious
author: nit p.

description: Country Sky was a great little hidden Chinese restaurant on Steiner near Chestnut Street.  It was Sunday at 4pm and there were a lot of restaurants in that area that either weren't open yet for a sit-down dinner or closed on Sundays.  It's an intimate little restaurant with great service.  The Sweet and Sour Chicken was fantastic.  We also had the fried wontons, honey walnut prawns, chicken chow mein (with mushrooms!).  Everything was good.  Even their Zin was tasty.  Definitely recommend stopping in here- food was provided fast and hot.  Beautiful presentation and large tea list.  Wander off Chestnut for a nice little hideaway.
author: Shannon M.

description:
I just got back from Country Sky Chinese and it was great! 

My dish was the Sesame Meatless Chicken, the sweetness of the 'sweet n sour' thew me off at first, but it was still great. My partner had the General Cho's Meatless Chicken and it was out of this world delicious- crispy, and just the right amount of spice. Cozy atmosphere as well, I think I found my new take-out obsession, that is, when I am lazy to walk the four blocks.

If you go, try a pot of Blue Tea- refreshing!
author: Ronnie Ray H.

description:
Good solid Chinese food at Great prices!!

Fresh vegetables and meat...etc...

Still a secret in the Marina.

Can you say lunch for 5.95!! Bingo!!
author: Ken G.

description:
We were very happy with this place. Dim sum was quite good. So was the orange chicken. I agree with one of the other posts that the Crab rangoons were a little skimpy on the  filling, but decent nonetheless. We try to order from somewhere new every time we get delivery and have eaten from numerous different chinese delivery places. 

I would have to say that this is the best so far in the Marina area for delivery (Ho's, Andy's, Tai Chi, etc.). Though Tai Chi might beat it out in some regards. If you're looking for good Chinese delivery I'd say give this place a try. We liked it slightly better than Tai Chi (which is excellent). Ho's and Andy's tend to be rather greasy. The fact that they do dim sum is an added bonus :-). 

Oh yeah, portions are not as large as other places too. So there's one caveat.
author: Jonathan Z.

description: I love Country Sky Chinese! They have never let me down, from the first time I ate in the restaurant  to every time I have ordered delivery from them. The selection is amazing, the food always arrives hot and tasty and sometimes they even give me extra fortune cookies!
author: Brenna L.

description: Don't get me wrong, I love the friendly service, but the food is just lackluster.  I would rather spend my money at Dragon Well.  The place has kind of a greasy smell when you walk in, but not so much so after you sit down.  I had the pot stickers, sesame chicken, hunan three delight with prawns, fish, and scallops, and brown rice with a couple Chinese beers.  It is plain okay; as I said there is better in the neighborhood.
author: Brian S.

description: The delivery guy here is one of the most awesome men in the Universe. After having difficulty with our front door buzzer/entry-system, he displayed his displeasure by executing a full roundhouse kick on the apparatus.
author: Scott W.

description: Awesome Chinese food in the marina.  I was really impressed by everything we got here.  The hot and sour soup was great, the crab rangoons had real crab, and the entrees had high quality vegetables.  A great option for Chinese in the marina.
author: Heather T.

description:
One word. Incredible.

I moved here in 2000 from New Orleans and my favorite cuisine aside from Cajun is Chinese.

For all of the places I've been to since I moved here this is my favorite. 

First impression: From the outside looking in you can tell the place is clean. It's a hundred steps above "House of Nan King's" dirty floors, musty air and rude staff. 

There aren't staff members making egg rolls on the tables next to you. There isn't a weird sense of potentially getting overcharged for add-ons with illegible checks that you can't dispute.

This place is Top Notch.  The food is extremely flavorful and not greasy like most other places. The service alone makes this incredible find even more amazing. 

I haven't even mentioned the hook of the best Dim Sum I've ever had and the Hot Tea selection that the owner personally goes over with you. Try the BLUE tea and ask him to explain why it's so good. 

I had a selection of Dim Sum and my favorite "Shrimp Chow Mein" last time I went, and again, not greasy, incredible flavor, and VERY economical. Two of my friends and I ate there for WITH a bottle of Pinot for under 50 bucks.

They are new and not that busy yet. By the time the word gets out this place will be jam packed with everyone including Michael Bauer who chooses the Top 100 restraunts in San Francisco. Get there while there is still time!
author: Dustin L.

description:
From New York to Phoenix and now living in San Franciso I have gone from the best Chinese in the country to the worst.  Luckily I found Country Sky when wondering in the Marina.
First this is the only Chinese place I can get the wife to eat at, that is saying a lot.  Country Sky is clean and the staff is very nice.  The fried rice is not my favorite but over all the food to above average for San Francisco.  I really do wonder why it is always dead in there,  I have been there many weekend nights and it is rare to see anyone else there. 
If you are looking for good consistant Chinese, check it out.
author: Andrew D.

description: So happy to finally find good Chinese food take out and delivery in SF.  I had the sesame chicken and beef and asparagus, and was very pleased.  sauces are flavorful.  their dim sum is also legit.
author: Adam W.

description: I was in the area and it was dinner time so stopped here to eat. I was pleasantly surprised at the service which was excellent as was the food. I mentioned to my waiter that I was in kind of a hurry and he was very accommodating. I'm not very knowledgeable about Chinese food so asked him for his recommendations. I walked in at 6 and at 7:15 was in my car and on my way. I had an excellent experience and put this address into my nav system because I plan on returning.
author: Carlie R.

description: The vegetable chow mein is pretty bomb. The schezuan tofu is alright. If you're getting take out or delivery and have rice at home, I would skip getting the rice, because it's not the greatest.
author: Rani M.

description: The worst chinese restaurant I have been to.  It's a joke really.  Ordered shrimp salad and shrimp was completely frozen - they didn't even bother to defrost it, wtf?!  Crab wontons had no crab in them and were burned.  The only reason we went there cause they have "they love us on yelp" sticker on their window.  I guess I have to take those with grain of salt.
author: Ruslan K.

description: I think the quality of the food and ingredients was good but the portion was a 1/3 of the size that you get at other places and much more money. I don't think that it's worth it. Plus, I ordered the fried banana desert and I got 5 small pieces for $4.50. That's almost a $1 for each inch of fried banana. Bummer :( It tasted good though.
author: FA B.

description:
the general tso's meatless chicken made my night. this is fake meat at its best. not too chewy or meaty that makes you wonder about the fake substance you are eating. and its lightly battered which I feel compliments fake chicken very well.  The sauce had a little spice, a little sweet- very yummy. and they deliver for free. I'm sold. i'll be back here many times.

UPDATE: their sanitary score is a 53 out of 100- that is disgusting. im not going back here until that changes.
author: Liz S.

description: a friend and i went to try this new spot in the Marina last week and we won't be going back, The service was fine, but the food was greasy and we both had upset stomachs later that night. appetizer and shrimp were covered in greasy batter. Chow fun was ok - but add that to the other two items and you'll need Pepto Bismo for dessert.
author: Amy M.

description: The food was pretty good, especially the dim sum. If I could, I would actually give this place 3.5 stars. You get what you pay for, considering the place isn't expensive. The dim sum was really great, very light and tasty. I also ordered the chicken kung pao, which was okay, but not quite 5-star quality. The real problem was the delivery time, which took over an hour and half (they estimated 40-60 minutes). The delivery guy was friendly and apologized, but if it's a busy night they should just elongate the estimated time.
author: Tali L.

description: We first visited Country Sky after a very disappointing visit to Dragon Well.  We loved it and have since been back many times and even had it delivered.  The service is impeccable.  The food is flavorful and fresh.  We've had shrimp, pork, veggies, soup, and dim sum and everything has been made to order and delicious.  We'll definitely keep going back and highly recommend you give it a try!
author: Bette K.

description: My roommate always raves about this place so my friends and I decided to stop in for dinner last night after a couple long days of drinking -- and boy were we happy we did! Everything was amazing and very fresh, from the potstickers to the BBQ pork buns. Our server was very attentive and friendly and was happy to offer suggestions when we were stuck deciding between things. When the bill came, we were even more pleased. $50 for all four of us to dine, including a 20% gratuity! We all left feeling very full and satisfied. I will definitely be back.
author: Ashley C.

description: This is the only decent chinese delivery i've had in this city (though i haven't made an exhaustive search.) The food was very good, and delivery took about 15 minutes on a saturday night. -1 star because one of our dishes was wrong.
author: Julia G.

description: The positive reviews are true!  Quality Chinese food (including dim sum) with fast delivery (less than 45 minutes).  I had sesame balls, shrimp dumplings, and orange chicken.  Warm, fresh, and really good.
author: Michele F.

description: I wasn't expecting much out of a small Marina Chinese restaurant, but Country Sky had GREAT dimsum.  A limited menu, granted, but still excellent.  The chow mein is good, too, and so are the tea specialties.  Very friendly owners and cute restaurant in general :)
author: Wendy T.

description:
5 stars becasue it's NOT in the MIssion....sorry Sharon T, I just had to

of course I used to be one of those "edgy mission people"....damn, was I cool

ordering delivery tonight, if it lives up to expectations, the 5-banger remains!
author: david s.

description: Very good service and food. Very quick, very nice, goog price.
author: Josu A.

description: I mostly like this place because they care about the interior design and a respectable dining experience. There are big chairs, booths, mirrors, brick, lanterns, and a mural along the main wall.  Their extensive tea menu describes the functions of each leaf--digestive aid, relaxing etc. Prices are reasonable and the service friendly. I thought the food was what you usually get for chinese (deep fried/stir-fried), but tasted better on the artistic plates that changed from appetizer to entree! I liked the intimate feel and the waiters did not make their presence obvious or obnoxious. Surprised me that most people on yelp get delivery. Not so crazy about the sesame meatless chicken. Next time I'll try the dimsum.
author: Kim G.

description: Ugh. Work across the street and decided to give a Chinese restaurant other than Dragon Well a chance - BIG mistake! I ordered the chicken chow mein (my standard order in a new place, 'cause I figure it's the hardest to screw up - chicken and noodles???), and what arrived at my table was a plate full of wormy-looking noodles, bits of chicken that had the texture of calamari, and limp soy sprouts that looked sad to be there. Ate two bites and now glare at it when I walk out the door every day.
author: Annie B.

description:
I came during an off-hour in late afternoon when I was the only customer.  Full staff, though, including a very loud kid. Didn't mind him, though. The service was polite and attentive.

I tried it out after randomly passing by the menu and noticing meatless General Tso's. I'm no vegetarian, but I'm all about lowering the meat intake. The meatless GT's were good, even if they did first strike me as being a little too reminiscent of Morningstar chik nuggets smothered in Chinese spices. The bright side is that the pieces are plumper and... well, meatier... than chik nuggets.

I had a side of brown rice, so I was too full to try any dessert. But I'll definitely be back. And maybe I'll experiment with some of the teas, too. Very nice tea menu! As fancy-looking as any wine list.
author: Joseph R.

description: This place is great!  The delivery is quick and the prices are reasonable.  The food is really good and not greasy.  We will continue to order from Country Sky!
author: Jeffrey T.

description: I've experienced better, but not much worse than this.  I'll chalk up all the good reviews to "different strokes for different folks", but I'll never get this food again.  The delivery was fast, but so was the onset of my MSG-induced headache.  Our chicken had straight up,  huge chunks of pure gristle and fat.  The beef was gray.  Veggies, smelly.  Wife, pissed.  Yours truly, crying.  I tried the leftovers just to make sure -stomach, pissed.    Should've ordered pizza.
author: Geoff M.

description: Yum!  We just ordered delivery from here, but probably shouldnt be telling you because it will make the place more busy!!  The food arrived hot and fresh and fast.  In particular I noticed the attention the food received, both in the preparation and in the presentation. To me, fresh food and clean packaging indicate a place worth ordering from.  I am glad they are in the neighborhood and give Dragon Well a reason to step up their game.
author: Mary W.

description:
After hearing of the opening and reading the reviews here, I was excited to order delivery. Monday, after a long weekend, I was thinking about Chinese food for dinner all day.  Barely in the door 2 minutes, I picked up the phone and placed my order. No problems ordering. I waited with great anticipation.  The food was at my door within 20 minutes (I live close by). I grabbed it, ran to the kitchen (not very far from the front door) and dug into the packaging.  My anticipation ended like the first glimpse of a bad blind date.  The food looked weird. I ordered General's Chicken (listed as a Chef's Specialty), bbq pork appetizer, hot and sour soup, and fried rice (anticipating leftovers for Tuesday).  The General's Chicken smelled burnt and was covered in a shiny sauce type thing. The bbq pork seemed to have the same sauce.  I decided to only eat the soup and pork and save the rest for the next day.  The soup was good, but no meat of any kind (isn't hot and sour soup supposed to have meat?).  The bbq pork was so salty, and covered with a horrible sauce that I could not eat it (I really am not that picky either.)  

The next day, I had a feeling I would be tossing the General's Chicken.  The rice was good, but as much as I tried to eat the chicken, I could manage only one bite.  It was as burnt as it looked, the sauce tasted like vinegar, and the chicken just seemed weird. Too gross to eat.

Oh well, I will continue to look for good Chinese delivery.
author: Brad Z.

description:
Wow...
So many reviews touting that "the food was good." The food was good... really? Man, this place should be submitted to the Guinness book for most overrated restaurant in the history of man kind. 
Sorry, the food was not good--not even close to it. My standards are not that low, especially in SF when you should expect a good plate of Chinese (considering your not so broke that you have to eat at the crappiest of places just to scrape by). Even the people at the only other occupied table next to us had complained about a very grotesque sounding desert. 
I'll tell you this, if you have any standards whatsoever... if you want to taste tomatoes in your tomato beef chow mien, rather than some fishy crap that I can't even describe... if you don't want your honey walnut prawns to come with an assortment of walnuts that are so frozen that the steam that escapes them isn't steam, but frosty mist... if you want hot and sour soup that's actually hot AND sour--do not go here! If your new to SF, or visiting SF from whatever east Jesus place that serves subpar Chinese, knock yourself out. But for the natives who know good Chinese, I just did you a fat favor, trust me!
Stay safe!
author: Mike S.

description:
I never write reviews but I had to give a shout out to Country Sky! Was totally craving Chinese and they totally delivered (in so many ways).

First, they delivered so fast and the food was literally steaming hot when it got here.  Second, I ordered Mu Shu Pork (yum!), Orange Chicken (yum!) and got Chow Mein for free.  All of that food for less than $20 and free delivery!  Cannot be beat!

Definitely will be my go-to for Chinese delivery in the future.
author: Jennifer B.

description: I loved their meatless dishes. Super Yummy. The Dim Sum was yummy too. The food was good and not really greasy, big plus! Delivery time was quicker then quoted. Overall good experience.
author: Jen H.

description:
Quick delivery and reasonable priced.  We ordered Hot and Sour soup, Lettuce Cup with Minced Chicken, Beef Broccoli, and Dim Sum Steamed BBQ Pork Dumplings.

The Hot and Sour soup was great, a bit of kick to it but not too hot for my mom.  The Lettuce Cup with Minced Chicken was not that great, possibly because it's not what I expected.  The place close to my home (Long Beach, CA) dices up the chicken much finer.  This chicken seemed soft and lots of frozen peas/corn in the mix.  I'd pass on it next time.  Beef Broccoli - Mom liked the fact that the Broccoli was still crunchy but the beef was just OK.  I loved the Steamed BBQ Pork Dumplings.
author: Cheryl D.

description:
The guy who runs the place is like the nicest person in the world. If you're not sure what you wnat, he will take his time with you and try to help you figure out exactly what you're craving (which is a challenge with Chinese food because you crave everything). And the dim sum is great. Try the "peach buns," or any kind of dim sumbuns really because they're all delicious.

update:
the general tso's mealtess chicken is AMAZIIIING! i get it every time i order now. this palce keeps getting better
author: R M.

description: Ordered from here on a few occasions, very fast delivery, affordable, yummy, and the only chinese food in san francisco that doesn't give me explosive......
author: sean f.

description: I was walking around the Marina and I bumped into this cozy little restaurant, I was impressed. I tried the combination sea food rice, it was tasty and spicy, I also tried their kung-pao chicken it packs a potent punch. They also have a good collection of tea, I tried the black lychee tea, and it was a blast.
author: Robie G.

description: This is my second choice chinese restaurant in the Marina.  Got the General Cho's chicken (Spelled wrong on Menu) which was eh and the crab rangoon which was burnt.  The service was friendly and fast but the food wasn't very good.  Definetely prefer Dragon Well.
author: Shannon B.

description:
*Based on Delivery only

I would actually give this place a 3.5 if I could because while I haven't had anything earth shattering, it has delivery dim sum which in itself deserves at least 3 stars for difficulty.

That being said, it has been all about the dim sum for me. When you need a fix, it does the trick. Quality varies I've found, but more often than not its surprisingly decent. I can at least say its better than a most of those take out dim sum shops in Chinatown with stuff pre-made.

Based on what I've had, I would say beef dishes are their weakest point. A little heavy on the garlic for my taste, and meat can be chewy.

I had some fish in a spicy sauce from the special menu that I thought was pretty good. For dim sum, the shrimp dumplings, the pork and veggie pan fried dumplings, and the bbq pork buns have been winners.
author: Pete L.

description:
i got delivery yesterday. the food tasted pretty good, chicken and beef were tender, etc.

then my appetite and overall experience got ruined by a FILTHY, DISGUSTING, and UNSANITARY cockroach or other bug that was mixed into my chicken fried rice that was luckily not bitten into. now i have to go listerine.

i purposely reactivated a useless yelp account just to say this to all of you.
author: Kevin S.

description: I was craving Chinese food last night. I ordered some food off of their website and walked the 5 blocks to pick it up. The atmosphere was quiet because it was less than an hour before closing. I ordered something to test how well they did on things I love (egg rolls, pot-stickers, Chicken chowmein, and pork buns). I'm pretty picky when it comes to Chinese food and to have to walk more than 2 blocks isn't a big deal but it better be good to get me to walk that far. This place is AWESOME!!!! The chicken in the chowmein was good, clean, good sizes of white chicken meat. Most places I go to have cartilage or fat that only gets found after you chew on it. I will definitely order again (probably have it delivered next time ;) ). The person that gave me my order took the time to mark on the menu all of the dishes they sell regularly. The other restaurants I've gone to would just say, "Oh everything is great," or just act like they didn't hear me. The fact that they are on Seamless.com will be helpful for me so that I can order my food on my cellphone and pick it up on my way home.
author: Matt L.

description:
First let me just state that I'm a HUGE dimsum lover.  And lucky for me I live in Inner Richmond, where Chinese restaurants, authentic or not, are abundant.  So naturally I was very excited when my boyfriend told me about this Chinese restaurant he'd found in the Marina and how good their dimsum was.  "Good Chinese food in the Marina?  Are you kidding me?"  But the way he raved about the place made me decide to give it a try(let me also add that my boyfriend isn't usually crazy about dimsum - so this was huge)
We got to the place and I immediately gave him my first nod of approval when I saw the decor: tasteful, cozy, and very clean.  We started off by ordering a pot of tea(Ging sen oolong, which was VERY good), then looked over the menu: standard Chinese dishes, with a section dedicated to dimsum.  The dimsum menu isn't super extensive, although it does include all the standard items, such as shrimp & chive dumpling, BBQ pork bun, pork suimai, fried turnip cake...  The owner, who was waiting on us, and who was by the way very friendly, told us our dimsum would take sometime to prepare, as they're all fresh-steamed or fried.  No problem.  The fresher the better.  
We ended up ordering six dishes(I was really hungry, and plus I am extremely greedy when it comes to trying out new restaurants):
- shrimp & chive dumplings
- chicken suimai
- steamed BBQ pork buns
- fried turnip cake
- sweet rice tamale(which is often called "sticky rice with pork wrapped in lotus leaves" at other restaurants)
- pan fried chive dumplings

We got the shrimp & chive dumplings first, and one bite into the juicy and decadent shrimp & chive dumpling I was sold.  It was delicious and I swear I could TASTE the freshness of the food.  We polished off our plates quicky, eagerly waiting for more.  I was just as impressed with our other dishes, especially the turnip cakes.  There's something about the way these cakes are prepared here that really sets them apart from the turnip cakes we've had at other dimsum places.  
The owner kept our teapot full the whole time, and really chatted up with us when he found out I'm from Taiwan(that alone should be indication of the authenticity of the food!)  It was overall an extremely pleasant dining experience.  And we left with our stomaches full and feeling content.  
I strongly recommend this place for dimsum(as since I haven't tried their regular main dishes I can't really vouch for those), and you should definitely have the dimsum there(as opposed to getting it to-go or having it delivered).  I'm planning on spreading the word to my dimsum-loving friends, and I can't wait to go back, only with a bigger group next time!
author: kristina h.

description: I have no idea why so many people like this place.  I ordered dim sum for delivery and the food was terrible, so bad that I threw it out.  The delivery guy was very nice however.   Don't fall for the other reviews like I did and go elsewhere for you dim sum fix!
author: Pam F.

description: It was so good, I fought the Fleet Week traffic and went back the next day. The boyfriend was sick all weekend and I was searching for some good hot n' sour soup to clear his sinuses and calm my nerves. We ventured into the Marina, finally found a parking space (fuck, I hate parking in this town) and went into Country Sky. Weird name for a Chinese restaurant and the music was odd (piano instrumental of Amazing Grace), but the place was clean and comfy and the food was fantastic! I had one of their hot teas, of which there was a nice selection to choose from, hot n' sour soup, pot stickers and orange chicken. The soup was spicy and freakin' hot, just the way I like it! The pot stickers were doughy and soft with an incredible dipping sauce and the orange chicken was not greasy at all. I must say that this is the very best Chinese food I have had since I moved to SF. Try it and I promise you won't be let down.
author: And e.

description: In a city filled with food delivery options, this is one of my favorites.  I am often too lazy to cook and as a result have a manila folder two inches thick filled with delivery menus.  I love that this place delivers dim sum.  I mean pretty decent dim sum.  And they deliver it promptly enough that it does not get soggy.  Everything from the siu mai to the pork buns to the shrimp dumplings are awesome.  Their regular entrees are excellent as well.  The pork pot stickers are very good.  I have a thing for Hong Kong style noodles made with chasu and bok choi.  Crispy noodles with a delicious gravy.  The string bean pork is one of my favorites too.  While I try to stay away from too much deep fried food, the sesame chicken is too hard to resist sometimes.  I like it because the sauce is not too sweet like others I have had.  The mongolian beef is pretty marginal.  Not much flavor.  One of the cool things is if you order two entrees, you get a free chow mein or fried rice.  Get the BBQ pork fried rice.  It is delicious.  They are always very good about telling you if you expect a delay with delivery because they are busy.  Really good value and delicious food.
author: David S.

description: very very fresh dim sum. everything tastes homemade and delicious. highly recommend
author: alisa o.

description: The atmosphere is cozy, modern, clean. The service was excellent. Very attentive wait staff and awesome owner. They made sure we enjoyed every course we ordered and refilled our beverages constantly. We had a couple main entree's (mushu pork, sesame chicken) and hot and sour soup, it was really good. We also had a few dim sum items, those were average. I guess overall we enjoyed the atmosphere, friendly service, good food and reasonable prices. We will definitely come back!
author: D B.

description: Quite possibly the worst Chinese food I've ever had.  Talk about mystery meat.  Both the beef and chicken were questionable at best.  Both tasted like the grinded remains that aren't suitable for eating.  Disgusting!
author: Jacob S.

description: My boy friend and I were walking around Marina area and found this little chinese restaurant.  We decided to give it a try and we're glad that we did.  We really enjoyed the food and the excellent service.  This is the best chinese restaurant (definitely way better than Dragon Wells on Chestnut St.) in the Marina area.  We have actually gone back to this restaurant the 2nd time and once again we enjoyed it very much.
author: Bella L.

description: first of all-- i know what you're thinking. why is this in my "why the inner richmond rules list" when it's on chestnut & steiner? well, because they DELIVER TO MY HOUSE IN THE INNER RICHMOND!! i heart delivery, and when hungover i realllllllllly heart delivery. anyway, i've never had any of the meat dishes here but the vegetarian stuff is great. they have two kinds of meatless "chicken" and delicious vegetarian hot and sour soup. one time i ordered veggie pot stickers and they turned out to have pork in them which was super gross, but mistakes happen and since i figured it out after one small bite i'm not deducting any stars, but just wanted to suggest that checking your pot stickers before you dig in is a good idea for all you other veggies out there. anyway, the soups and veggie dishes are great, and i so appreciate being able to enjoy them from the comfort of my own couch while watching 90210 or the golden girls. thanks country sky!
author: Jessica C.
